Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured, possibly White Ground, pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip glazed; in handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of upper part of draped youth, to right.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.1077 which does not have any incision preserved in the decoration of its preserved parts. For a discussion on Attic White Ground cups, see Mertens, J. 'Attic White-Ground Cups: A Special Class of Vases', Metropolitan Museum Journal 9, 1974, 91-108. She knows of no white-ground band-cup.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 399, no. B587)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0543) (Phase 1)
